nodes.bodyText: Could a check to see if the game is running also be added to the updateGameIfNecessary function? This way it doesn't even try to download if another game is running saving the network cycles as I think currently it only errors out after download when it tries to move the files
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -457,10 +473,14 @@ private void notifyCantPlayReplay(@Nullable Integer replayId, Throwable throwabl
         .thenCompose(featuredModBean -> updateGameIfNecessary(featuredModBean, null, modVersions, simModUids))

nodes.bodyText: also don't we want to display a meaningful Exception
what do you mean? To the user? That is done in an exceptionally

Have you ever seen
RuntimeException at X 
   at ...
   at ....
Caused by RealException: the message you are really looking for
   at ....

That happens if you pass on the causing Exception to a new on e thrown like here, what I suggested....
What if there is an unexpected Exception it is never logged we will never know what throwable really contained
ah yeah got it just misunderstood
this solves the issues with the game not terminating correctly... just so u understand.
This message is not really up to date anymore. it could really be anything that caused it but the game not terminating correctly should not be an issue anymore
